musicalLanguage.description: A left-hand pattern study for the most infectious rhythm in blues piano — the boogie-woogie bass. The repeating eighth-note pattern in the left hand creates a rolling, train-like momentum. Once your left hand has this on autopilot, you can add any blues melody on top.
keyMoments: Bar 1-2: The C boogie pattern — eight notes rolling like a freight train
Bar 3-4: Pattern continues — left hand should start feeling automatic
Bar 5-6: F boogie pattern — same shape transposed to the IV chord
Bar 7-8: Back to C — the pattern comes home
teachingGoals: Boogie-woogie left hand pattern — the foundation of blues piano
Left hand independence — keeping the pattern steady while right hand plays
Transposing the same pattern to different root notes (C, F)
styleTips: Practice the left hand ALONE first until it is automatic
Keep the eighth notes even and steady — this is the engine
Right hand starts very simple — just chord tones on the beat

measures.leftHand: C2:e E2:e G2:e A2:e C3:e A2:e G2:e E2:e
measures.teachingNote: C7 — right hand plays a simple triad. Left hand plays the classic boogie pattern: C-E-G-A-C-A-G-E.

measures.leftHand: C2:e E2:e G2:e A2:e C3:e A2:e G2:e E2:e
measures.teachingNote: C7 — right hand adds the b7 (Bb). Left hand keeps the exact same pattern.

measures.leftHand: C2:e E2:e G2:e A2:e C3:e A2:e G2:e E2:e
measures.teachingNote: C7 — simple back-and-forth melody. Focus on keeping the left hand steady.

measures.leftHand: C2:e E2:e G2:e A2:e C3:e A2:e G2:e E2:e
measures.teachingNote: C7 — adding some blues flavor with Bb. Four bars of C done. Get ready to shift!

measures.leftHand: F2:e A2:e C3:e D3:e F3:e D3:e C3:e A2:e
measures.teachingNote: F7 — SAME left hand shape, starting on F! F-A-C-D-F-D-C-A. Right hand shifts to F triad.

measures.leftHand: F2:e A2:e C3:e D3:e F3:e D3:e C3:e A2:e
measures.teachingNote: F7 — Eb is the b7 of F. Left hand pattern stays perfectly steady.

measures.leftHand: C2:e E2:e G2:e A2:e C3:e A2:e G2:e E2:e
measures.teachingNote: C7 — back to the tonic. The left hand pattern returns to C. Feels like home.

measures.leftHand: C2:e E2:e G2:e A2:e C3:e A2:e G2:e E2:e
measures.teachingNote: C7 — resolve down to C4. The boogie cycle is complete. Loop it!
